Name: AmigaOS classic
Creator: Commodore International  Haage & Partner  Hyperion Entertainment
Predecessor: TRIPOS (as the disk operating component of AmigaOS)
Cost availability: Discontinued; Bundled with hardware up to version 3.0 (Amiga International hardware came with 3.1); versions 2.1  3.0  3.1  3.5  3.9 also available as separate packages
Preferred license[g 1]: Proprietary  open source clone available under AROS Public License

Name: AmigaOS 4
Creator: Hyperion Entertainment
Cost availability: 4.0 bundled with hardware; 4.0 for classic and 4.1 available as standalone package at €29

Name: Chrome OS
Creator: Google
Preferred license[g 1]: Proprietary: Google OS Terms of Service

Name: eComStation
Creator: Serenity Systems  Mensys BV
Cost availability: Home-student edition (max. three per site) US$145.00 (equivalent to $161.49 in 2018) business edition $290.00

Name: GNU/Linux
Creator: Notable contributors include: Richard Stallman for GNU Project and Linus Torvalds for Linux and the Unixes they emulated; Red Hat  Debian Project See: Comparison of Linux distributions and Linux Kernel#Development
Initial public release: 1991 (kernel)  See: Comparison of Linux distributions and History of Linux

Name: Inferno
Creator: Bell Labs
Preferred license[g 1]: MIT  GNU GPL  GNU LGPL  LPL

Name: iOS
Creator: Apple Inc.
Cost availability: Bundled with hardware and free updates given to most existing users  subject to hardware requirements
Preferred license[g 1]: Proprietary higher level API layers; open source core system (ARM versions): APSL  GNU GPL  others

Name: Classic Mac OS
Creator: Apple Inc.
Cost availability: Discontinued; Was bundled with 68k and PowerPC Macs; versions 7-9 sold as retail upgrades[g 4]

Name: macOS
Creator: Apple Inc.
Cost availability: Bundled with hardware; No-cost update via Mac App Store for users of Mac OS X 10.6 or later  assuming hardware requirements are met
Preferred license[g 1]: Proprietary higher level API layers; open source core system (Intel-PowerPC versions): APSL  GNU GPL  others

Name: macOS Server
Creator: Apple Inc.
Cost availability: Previously bundled with hardware; No longer a separate operating system  but a group of services installed atop any current version of Mac OS X; US$19.99 on the Mac App Store
Preferred license[g 1]: Proprietary higher level API layers; open source core system (Intel-PowerPC versions): APSL  GNU GPL  others

Name: MPE
Creator: HP
Cost availability: Discontinued; Was bundled with HP-3000 CISC hardware "Classic"

Name: MPE/XL
Creator: HP
Cost availability: Discontinued; Was bundled with HP-3000 PA-RISC hardware

Name: NetWare
Creator: Novell
Cost availability: Superseded by Novell Open Enterprise Server; Was US$184 (equivalent to $214.88 in 2018) (one-user)

Name: NeXTSTEP
Creator: NeXT
Cost availability: Discontinued; Was bundled with hardware  then sold separately

Name: OpenIndiana
Creator: Many  based on software developed by Sun Microsystems and many others

Name: OS/2
Creator: IBM and Microsoft
Cost availability: Discontinued (see eComStation successor); Was US$300 (equivalent to $424.49 in 2018)

Name: QNX
Creator: QNX Software Systems
Cost availability: Bundled with BlackBerry 10 and PlayBook devices. Commercial; an academic version exists that needs authorization code before installing
Target system type: Automotive  medical  smartphones  consumer  industrial  embedded  safety

Name: Solaris
Creator: Sun  Oracle Corporation
Cost availability: Commercial; (but free/no-cost perpetual license when used "for the purpose of developing  testing  prototyping and demonstrating your applications"[4])

Name: Windows Server (NT family)
Creator: Microsoft
Cost availability: US$1050 5 CALs server; other editions dependent on number of CALs purchased

Name: Windows (NT family)
Creator: Microsoft
Cost availability: Windows 10 Home US$119  Windows 10 Pro US$199[5]
Target system type: Workstation  personal computer  media center  Tablet PC  embedded

Name: RISC OS
Creator: Acorn Computers
Predecessor: Arthur  also the BBC Master OS

Name: RISC OS 4
Creator: RISCOS Ltd  Pace plc
Cost availability: Bundled with hardware  then sold separately at £70 (US$127)

Name: RISC OS 5
Creator: Castle Technology  RISC OS Open
Cost availability: Free for non-commercial use (recent releases); formerly bundled with hardware

Name: RISC OS 6
Creator: RISCOS Ltd
Cost availability: Bundled with hardware  then sold separately at £70 (US$127)

Name: STOP 6  XTS-400
Creator: BAE Systems
Cost availability: US$60.000 (equivalent to $69.821 in 2018)+; bundled with XTS hardware and OEM licensed

Name: z/OS
Creator: IBM
Cost availability: Monthly license fee  about US$130 and up
